meanings.definition: Temporary wooden fences used for advertising
meanings.sent1: The hoardings along the street displayed colorful posters.
meanings.sent2: The company put up hoardings to promote their new product.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel climbed the hoardings and peeked at the passersby.
meanings.sent4: The hoardings acted as a shield against the strong wind.
meanings.sent5: The hoardings were like giant canvases for the artists to showcase their work.

meanings.definition: The act of collecting and storing large quantities of items
meanings.sent1: Her hoardings of vintage coins filled an entire room.
meanings.sent2: The hoardings of supplies in the bunker lasted them through the storm.
meanings.sent3: Grandma's hoardings of yarn made her the go-to person for knitting emergencies.
meanings.sent4: His hoardings of knowledge made him the trivia champion.
meanings.sent5: The hoardings of treasures in the pirate's chest gleamed in the moonlight.

meanings.definition: A barrier or partition made of wooden boards or metal sheets
meanings.sent1: The hoardings around the construction site kept pedestrians safe.
meanings.sent2: The hoardings separated the garden from the rest of the backyard.
meanings.sent3: The hoardings in the maze confused the participants during the race.
meanings.sent4: The hoardings in the old castle creaked in the eerie silence.
meanings.sent5: The hoardings in the haunted house hid secrets within their walls.
